### This code is for the simplification of mathematical expressions using Python's built in functions (example)

from sympy import *
x, y, z = symbols('x y z')
init_printing(use_unicode=True)

simplify(sin(x)**2 + cos(x)**2)

| $flavour$        | $size$           | $Price$   |
| :------------:   |:-------------:   | :------:  |
| $gold$           | $single$         | \$1600    |
| $vanilla$        | $double$         |   \$12    |
| $chocolate$      | $triple$         |    \$1    |
